conversation.content: [shaky voice] Seven years. Seven years of data collection, and they just— they just pull the plug? Tomorrow was supposed to be the start of my sabbatical. [bitter] I had everything planned. The conference in Copenhagen, the collaboration with Zhang's team, the whole— [pause] God, I already bought the plane tickets. [frustrated] You know what the worst part is? They knew. They had to have known for weeks, maybe months, and they wait until today to tell me? [angry] "Budget constraints," they said. Budget constraints! Meanwhile they're renovating the admin building for the third time in five years. [laugh] It's almost funny, isn't it? [very sad] All those grad students counting on this funding, all those nights in the lab, and for what? For, um... for nothing apparently. [sigh] I keep thinking maybe I misread the email. Maybe there's been some mistake. But no, it's right there in black and white: "effective immediately." [quietly] Twenty-three years at this institution and this is what I get. [long pause] I don't even know how I'm going to tell the team. They're so excited about the next phase. Were excited. [trailing off] I guess I should, uh... I should start making calls. Figure out what we can salvage. [exhausted] Tomorrow's not going to be much of a sabbatical after all.
